## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:description-outline-sharp" data-inline="false"></span> Description
An OBS event rotator widget for your Twitch events, social media or your own ones. The rotator is fully customizable, you can define which events show, what the text, color, font or size is.. and even what pictures are showing.

![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_title_2.gif)


- - - -

{: .note }
Streamer.bot is not a cloud-bot. That means it will only catch events when it's running. Any events done while offline won't show and you'd have to simulate the event to get them into the widget.

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:content-copy-outline-sharp" data-inline="false"></span> Import Code


---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="tabler:tool" data-inline="false"></span> Setup

1. Copy the import code from above and import the content.

    ![Import Actions](assets/media/import_actions.png)

2. Go into Streamer.bot and head to the tab `Servers/Clients -> WebSocket Server` and start the websocket server. Leave the adress at `127.0.0.1` and the port at `8080`. Check `Auto Start` as well. You can set a password, but you don't have to. If you do, make sure `Enforce for All Requests` stays unchecked.

   [![Picture](assets/media/notif_sb.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/notif_sb.png)
   
3. Copy the URL: 
   ```
   https://tawmae.github.io/overlays/EventRotator.html
   ```
   
4. Go into your OBS, create a browser source and paste the URL in there. Set the site to about 450x1200. You might want to fiddle around a little to see what fits.
   
   [![Picture](assets/media/notif_obs_1.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/notif_obs_1.png)
   
   [![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_obs.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/event_rotator_obs.png)

5. Back in Streamer.bot, go into the `[Event Rotator] 1 - Settings` action, rightclick the "Test" trigger and hit "Test Trigger". This will open the settings UI. You can then either directly customize everything you want or you can just hit "Save and Exit" to test the widget first.

6. Refresh the widget in OBS. 

7. Done 🥳

{: .new }
To have the events in multiple scenes, don't create an individual browser source in every scene, but instead create a new **nested** scene and put just a single browser source in there. Then place that scene into all your other scenes. This way you won't have to create 20 browser sources for 20 scenes.

- - - -

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:settings-alert-rounded" data-inline="false"></span> **Settings**

The rotator comes with a fully customizable settings UI. You can customize its looks, which events are supposed to show on there, what the duration for each rotation is and even define your own events. To initialize the rotator, you will need to run the settings UI at least once and save the settings.

[![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_settings_1.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/event_rotator_settings_1.png)

[![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_settings_2.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/event_rotator_settings_2.png)

[![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_settings_3.png)](https://tawmae.github.io/assets/media/event_rotator_settings_3.png)

Here's how it can look with different colors:

![Picture](assets/media/event_rotator_example.gif)

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:dataset-linked-sharp" data-inline="false"></span> URL Parameters 

You can add `?adress=` or  `?port` at the end of the URL in case you are using different IPs/ports.

---

{: .new }
Data for followers, subs, cheers and donations persist across sessions. If you want to clear them, interact with the browser source and hit the ESC key.
